intro: Oldenlandia strigulosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Oldenlandia strigulosa is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
